Data.Title: です (Desu): Verb Is - Present
Description: Verbs are always at the end of a sentence.
The verb です doesn't change depending on the thing you are talking about.
The vowel u of です (desu) it's almost mute. It's not pronounced.
The present is です. Examples
これ　は　りんご　です(Kore wa ringo desu) => This is an apple.
どれ　は　とり　です　か？ (Dore wa ringo desu ka) => Which is a bird?

Sentence: これ　は　いす　です
Kana: これ　は　いす　です

Data.Title: ですた (Deshita): Verb Is - Past
Description: ですた (Deshita) Past tense of です (Desu).
The vowel sound i it's not pronounced (deshta)
It goes at the end of the sentence as before. Examples:
これ　は　りんご　ですた (Kore wa ringo deshita) => This was an apple.
それ　は　テーブル　でした (Dore wa teeburu deshita) => That was a table.

Sentence: これ　は　ねこ　でした
Kana: これ　は　ねこ　でした

Data.Title: で　わ　ありません (De wa arimasen): Verb Is - Negative
Description: で　わ　ありません (De wa arimasen) Negative of です (Desu). Examples:
これ　は　りんご　で　わ　ありません (Kore wa ringo de wa arimasen) => This isn't an apple.
それ　は　テーブル　で　わ　ありません (Dore wa teeburu de wa arimasen) => That isn't a table.

Data.Title: です か？(Desu ka): Verb Is - Interrogativo
Description: The interrogative is simple, adding the particle か (Kat) at the end of a sentence, that sentence becomes an interrogation. Examples:
これ　は　りんご　です か？ (Kore wa ringo desu ka?) => Is this an apple.
どれ　は　とり　です　か？ (Dore wa ringo desu ka?) => Which is a bird?
これ　は　何(なん)　です　か？ (Kore wa nan desu ka?) => What is this?

Data.Title: Casual form of です(Desu)
Description: です is the formal form of the verb IS. The casual form is the next:
です(desu) Present => だ(da)
でした(deshita) Past => だった(datta)
で　わ　ありません (De wa arimasen) Negative => で　は　ない (de wa nai) or じゃ　ない (ja nai)
これ　は　りんご　じゃ　ない (Kore wa ringo ja nai) => This isn't an apple
あれ　は　とり　だった (Are wa ringo datta) => That wasn't a bird

Sentence: あれ　は　しゃしん　だ
それ　は いぬ　だった
あれ　は　とり　じゃ　ない
Kana: あれ　は　しゃしん　だ
それ　は いぬ　だった
あれ　は　とり　じゃ　ない
